title.narrative: EDUCATION OP 1 INCREASED AVAILABILITYOF SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2023 the GoM has increased the availability of services from preschool to lower secondary, attracting more boys and girls, including the most vulnerable children and during emergencies, children with disability, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 more boys and girls (5-18 years old) in Madagascar, specially the most excluded, will be exposed to effective learning experiences that will lead to the acquisition of the necessary competencies for an enriching life.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023 the GoM has increased the availability of services from preschool to lower secondary, attracting more boys and girls,including the most vulnerable children and during emergencies, children with disability

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF supported 328,000 children and adolescents (169,500 girls) including the most vulnerable and those with disabilities, for their retention and reintegration in school from pre-primary, primary and lower secondary education level through CRAN (catch-up classes), school construction and provision of school equipment. UNICEF also delivered emergency response to the COVID-19 pandemic and other hazards such as drought and cyclones in a very challenging context. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2022
